TypeSignature.Value: public class Location : Java.Lang.Object, Android.OS.IParcelable, IDisposable
.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Location extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.OS.IParcelable, class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: A data class representing a geographic location.

remarks.para: A data class representing a geographic location.
A location can consist of a latitude, longitude, timestamp, and other information such as bearing, altitude and velocity.
All locations generated by the are guaranteed to have a valid latitude, longitude, and timestamp (both UTC time and elapsed real-time since boot), all other parameters are optional.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual float Accuracy { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Get the estimated accuracy of this location, in meters.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Get the estimated accuracy of this location, in meters.
We define accuracy as the radius of 68% confidence. In other words, if you draw a circle centered at this location's latitude and longitude, and with a radius equal to the accuracy, then there is a 68% probability that the true location is inside the circle.
In statistical terms, it is assumed that location errors are random with a normal distribution, so the 68% confidence circle represents one standard deviation. Note that in practice, location errors do not always follow such a simple distribution.
This accuracy estimation is only concerned with horizontal accuracy, and does not indicate the accuracy of bearing, velocity or altitude if those are included in this Location.
If this location does not have an accuracy, then 0.0 is returned. All locations generated by the include an accuracy.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Set the estimated accuracy of this location, meters.
See for the definition of accuracy.
Following this call will return true.

Docs.summary: Get the altitude if available, in meters above the WGS 84 reference ellipsoid.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Get the altitude if available, in meters above the WGS 84 reference ellipsoid.
If this location does not have an altitude then 0.0 is returned.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Set the altitude, in meters above the WGS 84 reference ellipsoid.
Following this call will return true.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual float Bearing { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Get the bearing, in degrees.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Get the bearing, in degrees.
Bearing is the horizontal direction of travel of this device, and is not related to the device orientation. It is guaranteed to be in the range (0.0, 360.0] if the device has a bearing.
If this location does not have a bearing then 0.0 is returned.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Set the bearing, in degrees.
Bearing is the horizontal direction of travel of this device, and is not related to the device orientation.
The input will be wrapped into the range (0.0, 360.0].

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance float32 BearingTo(class Android.Locations.Location dest) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the approximate initial bearing in degrees East of true North when traveling along the shortest path between this location and the given location.

remarks.para: Returns the approximate initial bearing in degrees East of true North when traveling along the shortest path between this location and the given location. The shortest path is defined using the WGS84 ellipsoid. Locations that are (nearly) antipodal may produce meaningless results.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig float64 Convert(string coordinate) cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts a String in one of the formats described by FORMAT_DEGREES, FORMAT_MINUTES, or FORMAT_SECONDS into a double.

remarks.para: Converts a String in one of the formats described by FORMAT_DEGREES, FORMAT_MINUTES, or FORMAT_SECONDS into a double. This conversion is performed in a locale agnostic method, and so is not guaranteed to round-trip with .

Docs.exception: if the coordinate is not in one of the valid formats.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string Convert (double coordinate, Android.Locations.Format outputType);
.method public static hidebysig string Convert(float64 coordinate, valuetype Android.Locations.Format outputType) cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts a coordinate to a String representation.

remarks.para: Converts a coordinate to a String representation. The outputType may be one of FORMAT_DEGREES, FORMAT_MINUTES, or FORMAT_SECONDS. The coordinate must be a valid double between -180.0 and 180.0. This conversion is performed in a method that is dependent on the default locale, and so is not guaranteed to round-trip with .

Docs.exception: if coordinate is less than -180.0, greater than 180.0, or is not a number.
if outputType is not one of FORMAT_DEGREES, FORMAT_MINUTES, or FORMAT_SECONDS.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void DistanceBetween (double startLatitude, double startLongitude, double endLatitude, double endLongitude, float[] results);
.method public static hidebysig void DistanceBetween(float64 startLatitude, float64 startLongitude, float64 endLatitude, float64 endLongitude, float32[] results) cil managed

Docs.param: an array of floats to hold the results
Docs.summary: Computes the approximate distance in meters between two locations, and optionally the initial and final bearings of the shortest path between them.

remarks.para: Computes the approximate distance in meters between two locations, and optionally the initial and final bearings of the shortest path between them. Distance and bearing are defined using the WGS84 ellipsoid.

The computed distance is stored in results[0]. If results has length 2 or greater, the initial bearing is stored in results[1]. If results has length 3 or greater, the final bearing is stored in results[2].

Docs.exception: if results is null or has length

Docs.summary: Returns the approximate distance in meters between this location and the given location.

remarks.para: Returns the approximate distance in meters between this location and the given location. Distance is defined using the WGS84 ellipsoid.

public virtual long ElapsedRealtimeNanos { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Return the time of this fix, in elapsed real-time since system boot.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Return the time of this fix, in elapsed real-time since system boot.
This value can be reliably compared to , to calculate the age of a fix and to compare Location fixes. This is reliable because elapsed real-time is guaranteed monotonic for each system boot and continues to increment even when the system is in deep sleep (unlike .
All locations generated by the are guaranteed to have a valid elapsed real-time.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Set the time of this fix, in elapsed real-time since system boot.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.OS.Bundle Extras { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Returns additional provider-specific information about the location fix as a Bundle.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns additional provider-specific information about the location fix as a Bundle. The keys and values are determined by the provider. If no additional information is available, null is returned.
A number of common key/value pairs are listed below. Providers that use any of the keys on this list must provide the corresponding value as described below.
satellites - the number of satellites used to derive the fix

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the extra information associated with this fix to the given Bundle.

Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual long Time { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Return the UTC time of this fix, in milliseconds since January 1, 1970.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Return the UTC time of this fix, in milliseconds since January 1, 1970.
Note that the UTC time on a device is not monotonic: it can jump forwards or backwards unpredictably. So always use when calculating time deltas.
On the other hand, is useful for presenting a human readable time to the user, or for carefully comparing location fixes across reboot or across devices.
All locations generated by the are guaranteed to have a valid UTC time, however remember that the system time may have changed since the location was generated.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Set the UTC time of this fix, in milliseconds since January 1, 1970.
